title: ENERtec Asia 2024: Driving Sustainable Urban and Industrial Energy Transition in Southeast Asia - PR Newswire
summary: Informa Markets has rebranded the ASEAN M&E trade show to ENERtec Asia to focus on sustainable energy solutions and energy efficiency as a response to the urgent need for environmental sustainability. The event, scheduled for June 2024, will showcase innovations in renewable energy, electric vehicles, and smart energy management while fostering collaboration among industry professionals. It aims to drive the energy transition in Southeast Asia, emphasizing the importance of ESG compliance and Malaysia's leadership in this initiative.

title: 2024 oil and gas industry outlook - Deloitte
summary: The article discusses the challenges and opportunities in the refining industry amidst shifting energy demand and declining global refinery capacity. It highlights the importance of adopting low-carbon fuel alternatives, expanding biofuel production, exploring green hydrogen, electric vehicle initiatives, and adjusting chemicals production. Companies like BP and Marathon Petroleum are mentioned for their strategic investments in green technologies and innovations. Ultimately, success in the downstream sector relies on adapting to evolving demand trends and securing a robust supply chain.

title: National vision for engineering biology - GOV.UK
summary: The article outlines the UK's vision to become a global leader in engineering biology, emphasizing the transformative applications in healthcare, agriculture, and the chemical industry. It discusses the government's commitment to invest in research and development, talent, and infrastructure to foster a robust engineering biology sector, which will contribute to sustainable practices and innovation across various fields. Key priorities include responsible innovation, regulatory frameworks, and international collaboration to harness the economic potential of engineering biology while managing associated risks. The article highlights the urgency of adapting to global trends and ensuring that the UK remains competitive in a rapidly evolving bioeconomy.
